radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple stones within the pancreatic duct, with mild dilatation proximally.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Finding of pancreatic duct stones and dilatation suggested partial obstruction of the duct as a contributing factor to symptoms.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Dilation and irregularity of the pancreatic duct; short segment of ductal stricture in the mid body of the pancreas; multiple filling defects consistent with pancreatic stones.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Reported stability after removal of stones and stent following an earlier flare.
